intro: Gossypium eglandulosum, commonly known as the glandless cotton, is a species of flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and capsule fruits. The plant produces fibrous seeds that are used in textile manufacturing, similar to other cotton species. It typically grows in dry, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gossypium eglandulosum is an important crop in certain regions due to its unique fiber properties.
